channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Fly tip of large wooden pieces by tree near rear of fish and chip shop.

item.title: Large and deep pothole on Chislehurst road outside “Jon’s Hair Again”, 24th January
item.description:
Pothole has been there for months. Seems to get temporary repairs which don’t work. Pothole is very large and deep which will cause serious damage to any vehicle that hits it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-11, Chislehurst Road, Goddington, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road work signs, 24th January
item.description:
Road works have been cleared away and all other signage taken down. Signage at the turning into West House car park has been left and needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmcroft Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The ENTIRE road needs fixing, counted 178 potholes. HUNDRED AND SEVENTY EIGHT., 24th January
item.description:
Hi, I am appalled at the state of this road. There are no roads in Croydon that look like this, yet Bromley has multiple of these roads and this is one of the worst. Bromley is supposed to be a very good borough, please fix this please allocate some resources to this, it has caused me two flat tyres already and is driving many people out of the area and property prices lower. The entire road needs resurfacing, but if that is too much work then individual pothole repair can be carried out on the deeper more dangerous ones.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant litter, 24th January
item.description:
From the Broxbourne end of Irvine way to Perry Hall school there is a constant litter problem that needs monitoring.At the moment we have Red bull cans shoved between trees, a bin and several other items and general litter on a daily basis, this is ongoing.It is on the way to a school and is unsightly and not setting a good example to future generations
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broxbourne Road, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety issue, 24th January
item.description:
Property renovations to the property adjacent to roundabout. The owner has installed a fence and wall which restricts the vis splay. Fence 6ft and wall over 1m both seem to be to high and stop visibility of on coming traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Berens Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
